H0.text: First flown on the 27th July 1972, who built the F15 Eagle fighter. Boeing

H1.text: First flown on the 27th July 1972, who built the F15 Eagle fighter. Lockheed Martin

H2.text: First flown on the 27th July 1972, who built the F15 Eagle fighter. Northrop Grumman

H3.text: First flown on the 27th July 1972, who built the F15 Eagle fighter. MDTSC

A4.text: The McDonnell Douglas F-15 Eagle is an American twin-engine, all-weather fighter aircraft designed by McDonnell Douglas (now part of Boeing).

A5.text: Following reviews of proposals, the United States Air Force (USAF) selected McDonnell Douglas's design in 1969 to meet the service's need for a dedicated air superiority fighter.
